page.title: 06Sporting Life in Chorleywood
page.content: The main sports of Chorleywood are tennis, cricket and football. Football is played by the young of Chorleywood at Cubs, Schools and various clubs. The football pitch used by most boys is "The Swillet". Cricket is also played both by children and adults. There is a club which plays on the Common and which is divided into ages. Tennis is also played by both children and adults. There are several clubs in Chorleywood, public and private. A private club is situated in the grounds of Chorleywood House -as well as public courts. Golf is also played on the common. Swimming is also popular especially among the young though you have to be keen because you have to go out of Chorleywood to find a public swimming pool. The most popular is at Amersham but quite a lot of people go to William Penn School.
